original_title: Sri Lanka’s shares gain on crossings
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka‘s shares edged up in mid day trade, on crossings from Expolanka, an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was up 0.12 percent or 11.18 points to 9,306, the most liquid index S&P SL20 was up 0.40 percent or 10.51 points to 2,667.62 at 1230 hours.
The market opened on selling pressure and profit taking and the market paved to recovery on crossings from Expolanka and Royal Ceramics Lanka.
“A sizable crossing from Expolanka contributed to over 50 percent of the turnover,” an analyst said.

The construction sector has been seeing some attraction due to falling interest rates, moreover due to a stabilizing economy banks are offering lending at lower rates of interest pushing towards investment in the stock market, an analyst said.

Moreover, Sri Lanka’s broader National Consumer Price Index (NCPI) grew 22.1 percent in the 12-months to May down from to 33.2 percent a month ago, data from the Department of Census and Statistics showed.
Gainers during mid day trade were Royal Ceramics Lanka, Sampath Bank, Browns Investment. (Colombo/June22/2023)
